intro: Wormskioldia schinzii var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy wormskioldia, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are thick and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and purple, often blooming in late winter or early spring.
